node.title: China Touts Human Rights 'Values' as International Pressure Mounts on Olympics
node.description: New report out of China touts country's human rights 'values' as international pressure mounts on Olympics

node.title: Robert E. Lee statue in Charlottesville will be melted down into artwork
node.description: The statue will be given to the Jefferson School African American Heritage Center in Charlottesville.

node.title: Surgeon General Warns of Youth Mental Health Crisis
node.description: The coronavirus pandemic intensified a rise in adolescent depression, anxiety and mental health distress that was underway before the spring of 2020.

node.title: Amazon’s cloud computing outage disrupts its warehouse operations.
node.description: Amazon Web Services began reporting increased “error rates” in its cloud operations on Tuesday morning.

node.title: Rep. Dan Crenshaw Says 'Grifters' and 'Performance Artists' Exist Among Conservatives
node.description: "Performance artists are the ones who get all the attention...they know how to recite the lines they know that our voters want to hear," Crenshaw said.

node.title: Judge Temporarily Blocks Biden Vaccine Mandate for Federal Contractors
node.description: The mandate would have required that federal contractors get vaccinated by January 18.

node.title: Biden and Putin Hold 2-Hour Virtual Summit Over Ukraine
node.description: President Biden said a Russian invasion of Ukraine would result in heavy economic penalties for Mr. Putin

node.title: Here are five takeaways from the Biden-Putin call.
node.description: The meeting was a big foreign policy test for President Biden, with consequences for the stability of Europe, the credibility of American threats and the future of Ukraine.

node.title: Cop Injured, Suspect Killed As Both Hit By Car During Foot Chase Over Traffic Violation
node.description: The officer was pursuing the suspect and the two began a "physical struggle" in a street as the officer tried to take the man into custody.

node.title: 'Twiggy' Forrest, AGL look to turn ageing coal plants into futuristic hydrogen hub
node.description: The mining billionaire partners with the energy giant to explore the feasibility of building a green hydrogen hub on the site of the Liddell and Bayswater coal-fired power stations.

node.title: WHO says European COVID rates now highest in children, vaccine mandates should be 'last resort'
node.description: The World Health Organization says more needs to be done to protect schools amid a rapid increase in cases among children in Europe, the world's COVID epicentre.

node.title: Adelaide-based Army battalion being investigated for 'unacceptable behaviour'
node.description: The Inspector-General of the Australian Defence Force investigates "unacceptable behaviour" inside Army's 7th Battalion, but precise details of the allegations are being tightly held by the military.

node.title: Australia joins diplomatic boycott of Beijing Winter Olympics
node.description: Australia will join a formal boycott of the Beijing Winter Olympics, though the nation's athletes will still be allowed to attend and compete.

node.title: Border Patrol Agents Accused of Preventing Migrants From Filing for Asylum at Border
node.description: Because migrants have been unable to present their claims,  some have taken to crossing the Rio Grande and surrendering themselves to Border Patrol at the wall.

node.title: 'Teen Titans,' 'Avengers' Artist George Perez Says Cancer Will Kill Him in Under a Year
node.description: The acclaimed and beloved artist said he is opting to "let nature take its course" after his recent diagnosis of pancreatic cancer.

node.title: 102 Lawsuits Filed After Allegations of Abuse at New Hampshire Youth Detention Center
node.description: Some of the allegations include staff members choking children, burning them with cigarettes, and breaking their bones, attorney Rus Rilee said.

node.title: Te Arawa Lakes Trust utilising Mātauranga Māori to combat invasive weeds
node.description: Mātauranga Māori is being woven together with scientific concepts to combat invasive pest weeds displacing 15 native species in the Rotorua lakes.

node.title: France arrests possible suspect in Jamal Khashoggi's murder
node.description: Khalid Alotaibi, 33, is wanted by Turkey to face justice over the killing.

node.title: Lawyers in Jussie Smollett Case Tangle Over Motive as Testimony Ends
node.description: Mr. Smollett was questioned Tuesday by the prosecution about his interactions with his attackers shortly before the 2019 assault.

node.title: Mississippi Killer Confessed to Another Murder Before His Execution
node.description: David Neal Cox admitted to the 2007 killing of his sister-in-law, Felecia Cox, a cold case in which he had long been the prime suspect, prosecutors said.

node.title: Million-Dollar 'Gilgamesh Dream Tablet' Looted During Gulf War Finally Returned to Iraq
node.description: The cuneiform tablet has almost as wild of a story as the one depicted in the Epic of Gilgamesh.

node.title: Third Inmate Death Reported at Federal Prison as Dick Durbin Calls for Reform of Bureau
node.description: An inmate at a high-security Colorado prison died in an altercation Monday, the third inmate death at a federal prison in one month.

node.title: Biden Will Do to Russia What the U.S. Didn't in 2014, Sullivan Says After Call With Putin
node.description: Biden warned Putin Tuesday there would be "strong economic measures" taken if Russia decides to invade Ukraine.

node.title: Internet Wowed by German Shepherd's Spot-on Impression of Small Dog in Viral Video
node.description: "When your lease only permits one dog, and you have to explain that you do only have one dog," joked one commenter.

node.title: Phoenix Can Reduce Costs of Sweltering Summers With More Trees, Cool Roofs: Study
node.description: The city of Phoenix could save billions over the next three decades by adding "cool roofs" to buildings and planting more trees to create a "canopy."

node.title: Significant Outage for Amazon Web Services Stalls Netflix, Delta Airlines, Others
node.description: The outage caused by problems with Amazon's East Coast servers limited access to Netflix, Disney+ and Roku, and disrupted the company's smart home devices.

node.title: Internet Supports Redditor Who Purposefully 'Forgot' Turkey on Thanksgiving
node.description: The Redditor explained that her boyfriend's mother asked her to bring the turkey to dinner, but when she showed up empty-handed, the mother got upset.

node.title: Rohingya sue Facebook for $150bn over Myanmar hate speech
node.description: Dozens of Rohingya refugees in the UK and US have sued Facebook, accusing the social media giant of allowing hate speech against them to spread.

node.title: Love in the time of Covid: Visas, borders and the High Court
node.description: Two New Zealanders are heading to court today in a case that could affect thousands of migrants and their families.

node.title: In Bob Dole’s Hometown, Kansans Grieve for the Man and His Political Style
node.description: Residents of Russell, the town in Kansas where Mr. Dole grew up, spoke longingly of a bygone era of bipartisanship.
